repnme.cdata!: China - Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Urumqi Urban Transport
            Improvement Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: more work is needed to develop appropriate
            indicators for urban transport projects. The Bank should
            ensure that project components and schedule consider a
            natural 'learning curve' and other institutional
            capacity issues. Replicating successful urban transport
            projects is an important and valuable role for the World
            Bank in China as the country continues to urbanize and motorize.

repnme.cdata!:
Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement Project
            - environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement Project, which
            improves the existing road network, reduces traffic
            congestion, and develops public transport. There are three
            subprojects that are considered to have potential adverse
            environmental impacts: they involve the road network
            development component and the public transit improvement
            component. Mitigation measures planned are the following:
            Contain dust by separating demolition and excavation sites
            with tarpaulin or similar materials, watering unpaved roads,
            covering transport vehicles, regularly clearing out garbage,
            distancing temporary roads from residential areas, and
            properly operating maintaining, and repairing equipment and
            machinery. Reduce noise by restricting machinery use at
            night and restricting heavy vehicles by day, using sound
            absorption materials, prefabricating some structural
            components, routinely monitoring motor vehicle noise, and
            using vegetation buffers and zoning. Protect water quality
            by proper sewage disposal, and building temporary toilets
            and sewage collection facilities. Solid waste from
            construction will be removed from the site. Overpasses and
            underground passages will be built to ease pedestrian
            crossing through construction roads. Vehicles transporting
            hazardous materials must drive on specially designated
            roads. Lastly, people whose residences are converted for
            commercial use will receive preferential treatment.

439766.trustfund:
TF025408-PHRD-URUMQI URBAN TRANSPORT
            IMPROVEMENT PROJ.(BANK-EXECUTED),TF037564-CHINA - URUMQI URBAN TRANSPORT,TF036803-CHINA - URUMQI URBAN TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF033953-ASIA-PACIFIC REGION -
            SUSTAINABLE BANKING WITH POOR,TF025107-PHRD-URUMQI URBAN TRANSPORT
            PROJ. (RECIPIENT-EXECUTED)

repnme.cdata!: China - Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement
            Project aims to foster a multi-modal urban transport system
            which is planned, designed, and used for the safe,
            efficient, and healthy movement of people and goods. The
            project has five components. 1) Road Network Development
            will provide a 31.25 km "Ring Road" which will
            link the old central business district (CBD) to new
            development areas of the city, protect the CBD from
            extraneous traffic, and distribute regional traffic to the
            urban trunk road network. 2) Traffic Management and Road
            Safety will enhance the efficiency in the use of the
            existing road space and improve traffic safety. 3) Public
            Transport will develop public transport as a viable and
            sustainable travel alternative to the car by improving the
            level of existing bus services. It will support the ongoing
            reforms towards the strengthening of the regulatory and
            planning capabilities of the Urban Construction Commission
            and support commercial viability of Urumqi Public Transport
            Company. 4) Environmental Management will support
            Urumqi's leadership which is very active in promoting
            and implementing environmental protection and improvement
            initiatives, and further develop a Motor Vehicle Emission
            Control Strategy. 5) Institutional Development will
            strengthen local capacity and processes for urban transport,
            planning, programming and budgeting, and system management.

docna.cdata!: China - Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement Project

China - Urumqi Urban Transport
            Improvement Project

repnme.cdata!:
China - Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement
            Project : resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Resettlement Action Plan (RAP) will
            ensure that production levels, income-earning capacity, and
            living standards of the project-affected persons (PAPs),
            including minority groups, are improved, and/or restored to
            sustain their livelihoods. Therefore, the following measures
            will be taken to safeguard the entitlements of affected
            people: 1) ensure that all PAPs, including those living in
            urban state-owned land, receive compensation at replacement
            costs, for lost assets due to the project, and are
            resettled, and rehabilitated to be able to share the
            project's benefits; 2) particular attention will be
            given to vulnerable groups - including poor households,
            households with disabled members, households headed by
            women, and households where elderly people live alone - by
            providing assistance in building, and/or moving into their
            new houses; 3) full compensation, due to land acquisition
            will be provided at replacement costs; 4) affected units,
            and enterprises will be compensated for losses at
            replacement costs. Suitable alternative locations will be
            provided in case of relocation, to allow business
            continuity; 5) the community's services, and
            infrastructure will be restored/replaced as needed; 6) the
            independent monitoring institute will evaluate the
            implementation of land acquisition and resettlement issues,
            and include the participation of PAPs' representatives,
            who will be able to address possible grievances.

docna.cdata!:
China - Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement
            Project : resettlement action plan

repnme.cdata!:
Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement Project
            - environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement Project, which
            improves the existing road network, reduces traffic
            congestion, and develops public transport. There are three
            subprojects that are considered to have potential adverse
            environmental impacts: they involve the road network
            development component and the public transit improvement
            component. Mitigation measures planned are the following:
            Contain dust by separating demolition and excavation sites
            with tarpaulin or similar materials, watering unpaved roads,
            covering transport vehicles, regularly clearing out garbage,
            distancing temporary roads from residential areas, and
            properly operating maintaining, and repairing equipment and
            machinery. Reduce noise by restricting machinery use at
            night and restricting heavy vehicles by day, using sound
            absorption materials, prefabricating some structural
            components, routinely monitoring motor vehicle noise, and
            using vegetation buffers and zoning. Protect water quality
            by proper sewage disposal, and building temporary toilets
            and sewage collection facilities. Solid waste from
            construction will be removed from the site. Overpasses and
            underground passages will be built to ease pedestrian
            crossing through construction roads. Vehicles transporting
            hazardous materials must drive on specially designated
            roads. Lastly, people whose residences are converted for
            commercial use will receive preferential treatment.

Urumqi Urban Transport Improvement Project -
            environmental assessment

Urumqi Urban Transport
